page.title: 07Occupations in Kegworth.
page.content: Unfortunately in{Kegworth}there are not many{jobs}so most people leave the village to work. They travel, usually by car to the nearby towns of{Derby, {Leicester, Nottingham}or{Loughborough. The village has 26 small firms that {employ}mostly{Kegworth}people. These small firms include 9 shops, banks, a bakery, hairdressers, a few garages and a building society. In late 1984 the{Carters Soft Drinks Company}built a large warehouse on the outskirts of the village which is a shame really because it over shadows the village, and ruins the countryside around. There are four large works in the village these are{Slack and Parr, {National Westminster Bank Computer {Centre, Refractory Mouldings}and the {Carters Soft Drinks company. }
